content:
Hey guys.

I'm currently trying to install Zulip on an offline server (it has access to local mirror of official ubuntu (xenial). Install-process stops because it can't reach http://ppa.launchpad.net/
Is there any way around this, or do i have to download the entire thing to a local repo-server or similar?

Thanks for any help
Installing Zulip 1.8.1 on a clean ubuntu 16.04 server
I know the requirements-page lists outgoing http(s) access to internet, but i think we can live without "inline image previews", allthough i'm not entirely sure what that is.
@andip I think this is most likely possible but the person who can tell for sure is offline for now. He would be replying back to you when he comes online :)
@andip for doing a totally-off-the-internet server, I'd recommend installing the Docker image: https://github.com/zulip/docker-zulip

seems the docker image also needs connectivity to the internet.
Instructions says to use docker pull, which needs a local repo or internet-access, and starting the image also tries to get something from "https://quay.io/v1/", but i'll try getting those images and installing them too.

Thanks for your help @Tim Abbott . Got it up and running after just a little bit of trouble.
Time to test :)
Great, glad to hear it! :slight_smile:
